bill.title: Expanding Small Business Opportunities to all Women Act of 2017
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 51 (Thursday, March 23, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SERRANO:H.R. 1714.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the powers granted to theCongress by Article I, Section 8, Clauses 3 and 8 of theUnited States Constitution.[Page H2371]

item.title: Expanding Small Business Opportunities to all Women Act of 2017
To amend the Small Business Act to provide for the inclusion of unmarried women in the criteria for awarding a grant to a women's business center.
Expanding Small Business Opportunities to all Women Act of 2017

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Expanding Small Business Opportunities to all Women Act of 2017

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Expanding Small Business Opportunities to all Women Act of 2017

This bill amends the Small Business Act to revise the Small Business Administration's criteria for awarding a grant to a women's business center to include the ability of the applicant to provide training and services to a representative number of unmarried women who are both socially and economically disadvantaged.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
